title: MGIC Investment Reaches Analyst Target Price
description: In recent trading, shares of MGIC Investment Corp.  (Symbol: MTG) have crossed above the average analyst 12-month target price of $19.19, changing hands for $19.33/share.  When a stock reaches the target an analyst has set, the analyst logically has two ways to react: downgrade o
content:
In recent trading, shares of MGIC Investment Corp. (Symbol: MTG) have crossed above the average analyst 12-month target price of $19.19, changing hands for $19.33/share. When a stock reaches the target an analyst has set, the analyst logically has two ways to react: downgrade on valuation, or, re-adjust their target price to a higher level. Analyst reaction may also depend on the fundamental business developments that may be responsible for driving the stock price higher — if things are looking up for the company, perhaps it is time for that target price to be raised.

There are 8 different analyst targets within the Zacks coverage universe contributing to that average for MGIC Investment Corp. , but the average is just that — a mathematical average. There are analysts with lower targets than the average, including one looking for a price of $18.00. And then on the other side of the spectrum one analyst has a target as high as $21.00. The standard deviation is $1.066.

But the whole reason to look at the average MTG price target in the first place is to tap into a "wisdom of crowds" effort, putting together the contributions of all the individual minds who contributed to the ultimate number, as opposed to what just one particular expert believes. And so with MTG crossing above that average target price of $19.19/share, investors in MTG have been given a good signal to spend fresh time assessing the company and deciding for themselves: is $19.19 just one stop on the way to an even higher target, or has the valuation gotten stretched to the point where it is time to think about taking some chips off the table? Below is a table showing the current thinking of the analysts that cover MGIC Investment Corp. :

The average rating presented in the last row of the above table above is from 1 to 5 where 1 is Strong Buy and 5 is Strong Sell. This article used data provided by Zacks Investment Research via Quandl.com. Get the latest Zacks research report on MTG — FREE.

The Top 25 Broker Analyst Picks of the S&P 500 »
summary: Shares of MGIC Investment Corp. have surpassed the average analyst 12-month target price of $19.19, with shares trading at $18.19/share. This is usually a reaction to a potential downgrade on valuation or increase the target price. There are currently 8 different analyst targets within the Zacks coverage universe contributing to the average for MGIC. However, the average is a mathematical average, with lower targets and higher targets. The company's performance may depend on fundamental business developments driving the stock price higher. The average rating among analysts is from 1 to 5, with 1 being Strong Buy and 5 being Strong Sell.
shortSummary: MGIC Investment Corp. (MTG) shares rose above the average analyst target price of $19.19/share, indicating potential for price changes based on valuation and business developments.

| About Star Group LP |
| Star Group, L.P. is a full-service energy provider that specializes in the sale of home heating oil and propane, as well as air conditioning products and services to residential and commercial customers. Co. conducts its business through an operating subsidiary, Petro Holdings, Inc. Co. also sells diesel fuel, gasoline and home heating oil on a delivery only basis, and in certain of its marketing areas. Co. provides plumbing services primarily to home heating oil and propane customer base. Co.'s installation and services include equipment installations, equipment maintenance service contracts and billable call services. We show 40 historical shares outstanding datapoints in our SGU shares outstanding history coverage, used to compute SGU market cap on those dates. Understanding the changing numbers of shares outstanding, the changing share price, and the resulting changing SGU market cap history over the course of time is important for investors interested in comparing SGU's market cap history versus its peers. Many "beginner" or "novice" investors will look at one stock trading at a price of $10 per share and another trading at a price of $20 per share and think the latter company is worth twice as much. Of course, that is a completely meaningless comparison without also knowing how many shares outstanding there are for each of the two companies, and then calculating their respective market caps. Comparing the share price of SGU versus a peer is one thing; comparing SGU market cap versus a peer is a completely different story. Furthermore, via fluctuation both in per-share price and in the number of shares outstanding (via issuance of new shares over time, the repurchase of existing shares), the market cap for a company like SGU can fluctuate over the course of history. With this page we aim to empower investors researching SGU by allowing them to research the SGU market cap history. |

argos_summary: MGIC Investment Corp. (MTG) shares have recently surpassed the average analyst 12-month target price of $19.19, trading at $19.33. Analysts have varying target prices for the stock, with some suggesting a potential high of $21.00, while others predict a lower target of $18.00. This situation prompts investors to evaluate whether the stock's current valuation is justified or if it may be time to consider selling.
